title: A Century From Archduke's Death, Spotlight Turns Back To Bosnia
teaser: Bosnia has been buried in historic floods and paralyzed by political dysfunction. Now, locals in Sarajevo are frustrated that the world has only begun focusing on the region for the upcoming anniversary of Archduke Franz Ferdinand's assassination, which helped trigger World War I.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
